info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 11:42PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Catawba, Alexander, north central Lincoln, central Iredell and southeastern Caldwell Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1142 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Taylorsville, or near Bethlehem, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Statesville, Newton, Taylorsville, Lenoir, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Granite Falls and Bethlehem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
